radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. A stent is in place in the common bile duct. The gallbladder is distended, with minimal wall thickening and no pericholecystic fluid. A small 4-mm polyp is noted along its wall. Normal hepatopetal flow is seen within the main portal vein. The visualized portions of the pancreas are unremarkable, with a pancreatic duct measuring 2.5mm.
